title: Create an OpenShift project for OO
content:
Before installing OO Containerized, you need to create an OpenShift project.

Create an OpenShift project

  1. Log in to your OpenShift Container Platform.
  2. Click Projects, and then click Create Project.
  3. Enter a name in the Name field. For example, oo-prod.
  4. Click Create to create a deployment for OO.

Check the UID and GID

Make a note of the user ID (UID) and group ID (GID) in the project. Use these later when configuring NFS volumes and defining your custom values.yaml file.

  1. Click Projects, and then select the project created for the OO deployment. For example, oo-prod.
  2. Click Details, and then click the edit icon under Annotations.
  3. Check the UID and GID values. For example:  
    openshift.io/sa.scc.uid-range=1000000/10000
openshift.io/sa.scc.supplemental-groups=2000000/10000
  4. Take notes of the UID and GID, and then click Save.

Create the registry pull secret

Run the following command to create the registry pull secret:

kubectl create secret docker-registry registrypullsecret -n <namespaces> --docker-server=<image repository URL>  --docker-username=<username> --docker-password=<password>

Where:

Variable Description
<image repository URL> Specify the image registry URL.
<username> Use the registry username.
<password> Use the registry-admin password.
